title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Applications for COVID-Era Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) Loans

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Applications for COVID-Era Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) Loans
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all application materials submitted by the CFDFC for Paycheck Protection Program loans that were approved in 2020 and 2021.

These applications resulted in the approval of a $2.9 million loan to the CFDFC in April 2020, which was later forgiven, and a $2 million loan to the CFDFC in February 2021, which was also forgiven.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: Kentucky Department of Corrections Open Records Request - Quattrone Center

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky Department of Corrections Open Records Request - Quattrone Center
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Kentucky Department of Corrections,

Dear Department of Corrections,

Pursuant to the Kentucky Revised Statutes Open Records KRS 61.870 – 61.884, I am requesting access to all records related to the purchase of field drug testing supplies and technologies (used to identify unknown substances that are potentially contraband) by your agency from January 1, 2016 to the present. 

1.	Specifically, I am requesting contracts your agency or department has with providers of drug testing kit or device providers (such as colorimetric or presumptive field tests or testing insurance), or any other records indicating the quantity, cost, vendor, and model of each item or system purchased. This request includes materials related to but not limited to the following:
o	Colorimetric or presumptive field test kits, such as: 
	NIK Public Safety kits 
	Sirchie NARK II kits
	Field Forensics DABIT kits
	Mistral drug identification/detection kits
	M.M.C. International B.V. presumptive drug tests
	TN Scientific Mandelin Reagent drug testing kits
	Macherey-Nagel MEDI-TEST
	Any other colorimetric or presumptive kits
o	Instrument-based technologies, including: 
	Raman spectroscopy devices
	Infrared (IR) spectroscopy devices
	Ion mobility spectrometry (IMS) devices
	Mass spectrometry (MS) devices
	Any other field-portable drug identification technologies
1.	Total annual budget allocated to the purchase or acquisition of such drug testing kits or devices.
2.	Spending information (such as invoices, purchase orders, or receipts) for any presumptive drug testing kits or devices.
3.	This request does not include urine, blood, or other tests designed to identify drug compounds in the human body. This request is made as part of an academic research project examining the use and cost of field drug testing technologies by law enforcement and correctional agencies nationwide. If possible, I request that the records be provided in electronic format (PDF, Excel, or CSV).

If any part of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including the specific exemption(s) relied upon. If the requested records are available in part, I request access to all segregable portions. Should there be any material cost (defined as more than $100) associated with providing the requested information, please provide me with an estimate before proceeding with any work.

Please contact me at QuattroneResearch@law.upenn.edu or 215-746-1251 if you have any questions or require clarification. Thank you for your time and assistance.

Sincerely,

 
Ross Miller
Assistant Director
Quattrone Center for the Fair Administration of Justice

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ross Miller

title: Alabama Department of Corrections Open Records Request - Quattrone Center

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Alabama Department of Corrections (ADOC)

Dear ADOC,

Pursuant to the State of Alabama Department of Corrections Administrative Regulation Number 23 published on February 19, 2025, I am requesting access to all records related to the purchase of field drug testing supplies and technologies (used to identify unknown substances that are potentially contraband) by your agency from January 1, 2016 to the present. 

Specifically, I am requesting purchasing records, invoices, receipts, or any other documentation your agency or department regarding the purchase of drug testing kit or devices (such as colorimetric or presumptive field tests or testing insurance), or any other records indicating the quantity, cost, vendor, and model of each item or system purchased. 

1.	 This request includes materials related to but not limited to the following:
o	Colorimetric or presumptive field test kits, such as: 
	NIK Public Safety kits 
	Sirchie NARK II kits
	Field Forensics DABIT kits
	Mistral drug identification/detection kits
	M.M.C. International B.V. presumptive drug tests
	TN Scientific Mandelin Reagent drug testing kits
	Macherey-Nagel MEDI-TEST
	Nartec testing supplies
	Narkit tests
	Any other colorimetric or presumptive kits
o	Instrument-based technologies, including: 
	Raman spectroscopy devices
	Infrared (IR) spectroscopy devices
	Ion mobility spectrometry (IMS) devices
	Mass spectrometry (MS) devices
	Any other field-portable drug identification technologies

This request does not include urine, blood, or other tests designed to identify drug compounds in the human body.

1.	Total annual budget allocated to the purchase or acquisition of such drug testing kits or devices.
2.	Contracts for any presumptive drug testing kits or devices.
3.	This request is made as part of an academic research project examining the use and cost of field drug testing technologies by law enforcement and correctional agencies nationwide. If possible, I request that the records be provided in electronic format (PDF, Excel, or CSV).

If any part of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including the specific exemption(s) relied upon. If the requested records are available in part, I request access to all segregable portions. Should there be any material cost (defined as more than $100) associated with providing the requested information, please provide me with an estimate before proceeding with any work.

Please contact me at QuattroneResearch@law.upenn.edu or 215-746-1251 if you have any questions or require clarification. Thank you for your time and assistance.

Sincerely,

 
Ross Miller
Assistant Director
Quattrone Center for the Fair Administration of Justice

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Ross Miller.

title: Contract Documents for GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Hampshire County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Contract Documents for GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Hampshire County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All contract documents related to your GPS monitoring program, including the name(s) of the GPS provider(s) your office contracts with. I also request a copy of the current contract with your GPS provider(s), and any regulations, policies, or procedures your office uses to govern the GPS program.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

title: Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera and In-Car Video Footage，Case No.: 05-2024-CF-015716-AXXX-BC

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Body-Worn Camera and In-Car Video Footage，Case No.: 05-2024-CF-015716-AXXX-BC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

ursuant to **Fla. Stat. § 119.07**, I request copies of any and all **body-worn camera (BWC)** and **in-car video (ICV)** recordings related to the arrest of **Mr. Rick Phillip Parker** on **January 15, 2024**, by officers of the **Rockledge Police Department**. Relevant case details:

* **Court Case Number:** 05-2024-CF-015716-AXXX-BC
* **Defendant:** Parker, Rick Phillip (DOB 07/05/1979)
* **Offense Date & Time:** January 15 2024, 12:38 PM
* **Jurisdiction:** Rockledge, Florida
* **Arresting Agency Case/Arrest No.:** 2024-00001646
* **Charging Agency:** Rockledge Police Department

**Initial charge filed** on January 15 2024:
– Retail Theft (\$750 or more) — Fla. Stat. § 812.015(8)(a) — 3rd-Degree Felony

---

### Records requested

1. **All BWC footage** captured by any Rockledge Police Department officer while responding to, arriving at, detaining, arresting, transporting, or otherwise processing Mr. Parker on January 15 2024.
2. **All ICV (dash-camera) footage** from any patrol vehicle involved in the stop, arrest, transport, or booking of Mr. Parker on that date.

If any portion of the requested footage is exempt from disclosure, please **cite the specific statutory exemption** and release every reasonably segregable non-exempt portion. Where redactions are necessary, kindly provide a **written explanation** of the legal basis for each redaction.

title: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 to 61.884), I respectfully request the following public records:

⸻

1. Law Enforcement Certifications (Statewide):
	•	A list of all individuals certified as peace officers in the Commonwealth of Kentucky as of the date of this request.
	•	For each officer: full name, date of birth (or year of birth), employing agency, certification status (active/inactive/expired), certification type (e.g., POPS), issue date, and expiration date.
	•	Please include any notes regarding pre-certification, conditional certification, or decertification.

2. Brady/Giglio Disclosure List (Commonwealth of Kentucky):
	•	A current list of law enforcement officers or public officials who are known to be subject to Brady or Giglio disclosure obligations due to credibility, misconduct, or dishonesty issues.
	•	Please include any officers flagged or designated by prosecutors, the Kentucky State Police, the Kentucky Law Enforcement Council, or the Office of the Attorney General.
	•	If no centralized list exists, please provide any policy or guidance that governs Brady/Giglio reporting within the Commonwealth.

3. Oaths of Office and Official Bonds (Graves County):
	•	Certified copies of the oaths of office and official bonds for all currently serving public officials in Graves County, including:
	•	All deputies, command staff, and elected officials in the Graves County Sheriff’s Office
	•	All Mayfield Police Department officers
	•	All county-level judges and prosecutors
	•	The Graves County Clerk, County Attorney, and all magistrates or county commissioners

This request is submitted in good faith for public accountability and transparency and is specifically intended to confirm the legal authority, certification, and ethical standing of public officials acting within Graves County and the Commonwealth.

I am a resident of Kentucky, and this request is made in accordance with 21-ORD-193 and KRS 61.872(1).

I prefer digital delivery of responsive documents to: pager06@gmail.com. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me in advance.

Thank you for your time and attention to this request.

Sincerely,
Paige Kathleen Allen
P.O. Box 322
Mayfield, KY 42066
Email: pager06@gmail.com
Phone: (270) 205-1773

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paige Allen

title: 9/11 Pentagon Videos

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 9/11 Pentagon Videos
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, reports, logs, inventories, metadata, and copies of video footage (in any and all formats, including digital files, VHS, DVD, CD-ROM, etc.) specifically around any media that the D.O.D collected in relation to the investigation of the Pentagon attack on September 11, 2001 involving AA Flight 77.

Specifically, I request:

1. A list of all video recordings concerning the Pentagon incident on 9/11, including:
• The generalized location(s) from which video was collected.
• The dates on which these videos were collected.
• The formats and media types of the videos collected.
• Any documentation or inventory lists identifying or describing the collected footage.

2. A list or index of any videos related to this inquiry material that have not been released to the public from September 11, 2001 to the date of this request, including reasons for nondisclosure if applicable.

3. Information on the current physical or digital storage location of all such videos related to this inquiry material, including where and how the footage is archived or maintained.

4. Any communications, memoranda, or internal records that discuss or determine the release or withholding of any of this video footage from the public regarding this inquiry material.

Please include all responsive records regardless of their format or origin (e.g., internal records, communications with other government agencies, or third-party submissions).

It should be noted that multiple security cameras on the Pentagon property can be seen in various background video and images from 9/11/2001 that haven't been released to the public, such as:
•The south west corner of the heliport building there's a security camera clearly visible. A clear image by PH2 Jim Watson, USN titled "A burned-out vehicle sits in the parking lot near the Pentagon building hours after the September 11, 2001 attack"  clearly shows a security camera. 
•Throughout the Pentagon structure you can see camera's that are on a candy cane type of mounts along with lighting fixtures near by on the roof of E-ring. At least 3 can be spotted that would be of interest as seen by photographs taken by: CPL Jason Ingersoll, Usmc,  TSGT Cedric H. Rudisill, USAF,  PH2 Jim Watson, USN
• Parking Lot Security Cameras, if any. 

Also, the Navy Annex building (known as Federal Office Building 2), controlled by the Dept. of the Navy until its demolition, was in direct line with Flight 77 flight path and there are security cameras throughout that complex, including the parking lot and rooftop corners that can be seen from pictures taken by  CPL Jason Ingersoll, Usmc on September 11, 2001 that may have captured AA Flight 77.

These camera views indicated above are noticeable as there may be more that aren't seen. The D.O.D. previously released 2 security videos that stemmed from the December 2004 Freedom of Information Act request by Judicial Watch.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Kallas

title: Records related to Unidentified Remains in NYC from 1999-2005

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records related to Unidentified Remains in NYC from 1999-2005
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of unidentified female remains in New York City, particularly Brooklyn, from March 1999–2005, matching the description of Leanne Marie Hausberg (DOB: ~1985, NamUs #MP5599, NCMEC #861608, Navajo/White, 5’4”, 120 lbs, brown hair/eyes, small scar on right cheek), including any DNA, dental, or physical comparisons to her profile.
2. OCME’s protocols or reports on identifying Indigenous missing persons (1999–present), particularly regarding misclassification (e.g., Navajo/White listed as White or Hispanic).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Aziz
